skill.name: ghe-transition
skill.description:
CHANGE phases in the GitHub Elements workflow. Closes current thread and opens next phase thread. This is a PHASE CHANGE operation, not just saving progress.

USE THIS SKILL WHEN:
- User says "transition to TEST" or "move to REVIEW"
- User says "I'm done with DEV, start TEST" or "DEV complete"
- User says "advance to next phase" or "close this phase"
- User says "demote to DEV" (from TEST or REVIEW)
- User says "tests pass, ready for review"
- User says "merge this" (after REVIEW PASS)
- User explicitly wants to END current phase and BEGIN next

DO NOT USE THIS SKILL WHEN:
- User just wants to SEE status (use ghe-status)
- User wants to START work on new issue (use ghe-claim)
- User wants to SAVE progress but CONTINUE working (use ghe-checkpoint)
- User wants reports (use ghe-report)
- User is not ready to END current phase

IMPORTANT: This CLOSES current thread and OPENS next thread. Use ghe-checkpoint if you just want to save progress without changing phases.

EXAMPLES:
<example>
Context: DEV work complete, ready for testing
user: "I'm done with DEV, transition to TEST"
assistant: "I'll use ghe-transition to close DEV and open TEST thread"
</example>
<example>
Context: All tests pass, ready for review
user: "Tests pass, move to REVIEW"
assistant: "I'll use ghe-transition to close TEST and open REVIEW thread"
</example>
<example>
Context: Structural issues found in TEST
user: "This needs structural changes, demote to DEV"
assistant: "I'll use ghe-transition to demote from TEST back to DEV"
</example>
<example>
Context: REVIEW passed, ready to merge
user: "REVIEW passed, merge it"
assistant: "I'll use ghe-transition to complete the workflow and merge"
</example>
skill.summary: Change phases in GitHub Elements workflow. Closes current thread and opens next phase thread.
skill.author: Emasoft

security_audit.summary: This skill is pure documentation with no executable code. All 15 static findings are false positives caused by pattern-matching on markdown documentation text. The skill describes a legitimate workflow management system for GitHub Elements phase transitions.

content.value_statement: Managing multi-phase development workflows requires manually tracking and closing threads. This skill automates phase transitions in GitHub Elements, closing the current thread and opening the next phase thread with proper validation.
actual_capabilities: Validate phase transition prerequisites using the phase-gate agent
Close current thread and open next phase thread in GitHub
Manage demotions between phases (TEST to DEV, REVIEW to DEV)
Handle final merge after REVIEW passes
Sync memory bank state during phase transitions
Respect enforcement level settings from configuration
limitations: Requires GitHub Elements workflow to be set up in the project
Cannot execute transitions without proper permissions on the GitHub repository
Does not create new issues from scratch, only transitions existing workflow threads
Does not provide status reports (use ghe-status for that)

use_cases.title: Advance from DEV to TEST phase
use_cases.description: Complete development work and transition the issue thread to the TEST phase for quality validation.
use_cases.target_user: Developers who finished coding and need to move work to testing

use_cases.title: Move from TEST to REVIEW phase
use_cases.description: After tests pass, transition the thread to REVIEW phase for final code review and merge approval.
use_cases.target_user: QA engineers or developers verifying test completion

use_cases.title: Demote issues back to DEV
use_cases.description: When structural issues are found during TEST or REVIEW, demote the issue back to DEV for rework.
use_cases.target_user: QA engineers or reviewers who find blocking issues

prompt_templates.title: Basic phase transition
prompt_templates.prompt: I'm done with DEV, transition this issue to TEST phase.
prompt_templates.scenario: Standard transition from development to testing

prompt_templates.title: Demotion request
prompt_templates.prompt: We found structural issues that need rework. Please demote this back to DEV.
prompt_templates.scenario: Moving an issue backwards due to blocking problems

prompt_templates.title: Final merge transition
prompt_templates.prompt: Review passed. This is ready to merge. Please complete the transition.

prompt_templates.title: Complete workflow transition
prompt_templates.prompt: All tests are passing and this is ready for review. Move it to REVIEW phase.
prompt_templates.scenario: Transition from testing to review phase

output_examples.input: Transition this issue to REVIEW phase. Tests are all passing.
output: All tests have passed. Prerequisites for REVIEW phase are met.
Current thread (TEST) has been closed with completion comment.
New thread (REVIEW) has been created with 'REVIEW' label.
Threads have been linked for traceability.
Memory bank has been updated: removed from activeContext.md, added to progress.md.

output_examples.input: Demote this back to DEV. The architecture needs changes.
output: Demotion to DEV is allowed from TEST phase.
Current thread (TEST) has been closed with demotion note.
New thread (DEV) has been opened with 'DEV' label.
Memory bank has been updated to reflect demotion status.

best_practices: Use ghe-checkpoint to save progress if you want to continue working in the same phase
Ensure completion comments exist before attempting transitions
Verify tests are passing before transitioning to REVIEW phase
anti_patterns: Using ghe-transition just to check status (use ghe-status instead)
Transitioning without ensuring prerequisites are met
Using this skill to create new issues from scratch (use ghe-claim instead)

faq.question: What is the difference between ghe-transition and ghe-checkpoint?
faq.answer: ghe-transition closes the current phase thread and opens the next phase thread. ghe-checkpoint saves progress but keeps you in the same phase.

faq.question: Can I transition from DEV directly to REVIEW?
faq.answer: No. Transitions must follow the workflow: DEV to TEST, then TEST to REVIEW. Direct transitions are blocked.

faq.question: What happens if phase-gate validation fails?
faq.answer: The transition is blocked. The skill reports why validation failed and you must address the issues before retrying.

faq.question: Does this skill work with any GitHub issue?
faq.answer: No. The issue must be part of the GitHub Elements workflow system with proper labels and thread structure.

faq.question: Can I transition from REVIEW back to TEST?
faq.answer: No. If REVIEW fails, you must demote to DEV, not TEST. This prevents skipping validation steps.

faq.question: How does memory sync work during transition?
faq.answer: The memory-sync agent updates the SERENA memory bank, moving the issue from activeContext.md to progress.md and preparing for the new thread.
